intro: Minuartia alpuensis, commonly known as the alpine rock-cress, is a small, perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are small, hairy, and often arranged in a rosette pattern, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Minuartia alpuensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high altitudes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
